meals.name: Pre-Workout Meal

foods.item: Overnight oats with almond milk and raisins

meals.rationale: This meal provides a moderate amount of carbohydrates to top off glycogen stores and a small amount of protein to start muscle protein synthesis. The use of almond milk and raisins ensures low FODMAP and easy digestion. This aligns with the recommendation to consume 1-4 g/kg of carbohydrates 1-4 hours before exercise (ACSM2016).

meals.name: Pre-Workout Snack

foods.item: Banana and a scoop of protein powder in water

meals.rationale: This snack provides a quick source of carbohydrates to maintain blood glucose levels during the workout and a small amount of protein to aid muscle repair. The banana is easily digestible and provides essential vitamins and minerals. This aligns with the recommendation to consume 0.5-1.0 g/kg of carbohydrates 1 hour before exercise (ACSM2016).

meals.name: Intra-Workout Hydration
meals.rationale: This sports drink provides carbohydrates to sustain performance and electrolytes to replace sweat losses. The recommendation is to consume 30-60 g of carbohydrates per hour during endurance exercise (ISSN2017).

meals.name: Post-Workout Meal

foods.item: Grilled chicken breast with white rice and steamed zucchini

meals.rationale: This meal provides a balance of carbohydrates to replenish glycogen stores and protein to aid muscle repair. The use of white rice ensures rapid digestion and absorption of carbohydrates. The recommendation is to consume 1.0-1.2 g/kg of carbohydrates and 0.2-0.4 g/kg of protein within 30 minutes after exercise (ISSN2017).

meals.name: Afternoon Snack

foods.item: Greek yogurt with honey and almonds

meals.rationale: This snack provides a balance of carbohydrates, protein, and healthy fats to sustain energy levels and aid muscle recovery. The use of Greek yogurt ensures a high protein content. This aligns with the recommendation to consume protein evenly throughout the day (Morton2018).

meals.name: Pre-Workout Meal

foods.item: Whole grain bread with tuna and avocado

meals.rationale: This meal provides a balance of carbohydrates, protein, and healthy fats to sustain energy levels during the workout. The use of whole grain bread ensures a moderate amount of fiber for digestion. This aligns with the recommendation to consume 1.0-1.5 g/kg of carbohydrates 1-2 hours before exercise (ISSN2017).

meals.name: Pre-Workout Snack
meals.rationale: This snack provides a quick source of carbohydrates to maintain blood glucose levels during the workout. The energy gel is easily digestible and provides essential electrolytes. This aligns with the recommendation to consume 0.5-1.0 g/kg of carbohydrates 30-60 minutes before exercise (ACSM2016).

meals.name: Intra-Workout Hydration
meals.rationale: This sports drink provides carbohydrates to sustain performance and electrolytes to replace sweat losses. The recommendation is to consume 30-60 g of carbohydrates per hour during endurance exercise (ISSN2017).

meals.name: Post-Workout Meal

foods.item: Grilled salmon with quinoa and steamed broccoli

meals.rationale: This meal provides a balance of carbohydrates to replenish glycogen stores and protein to aid muscle repair. The use of quinoa ensures a high protein and fiber content. The recommendation is to consume 1.0-1.2 g/kg of carbohydrates and 0.2-0.4 g/kg of protein within 30 minutes after exercise (ISSN2017).
israel_alternatives: Quinoa from the health food store

key_recommendations: Consume a balance of carbohydrates, protein, and healthy fats throughout the day to sustain energy levels and aid muscle recovery.
Hydrate adequately before, during, and after workouts to replace sweat losses and maintain performance.
Include a variety of nutrient-dense foods to ensure adequate intake of vitamins and minerals.
Adjust portion sizes and macronutrient ratios based on individual needs and training intensity.
Monitor and adjust sodium intake to meet daily targets and replace sweat losses during workouts.

meals.name: Pre-Workout Breakfast

foods.item: 150g oats with 1 banana, 250ml soy milk, 1 tbsp honey
1 whole wheat toast with 1 tbsp almond butter

meals.rationale: This meal provides a balanced mix of carbohydrates and protein to fuel the upcoming workouts. The oats and banana provide readily available carbohydrates, while the soy milk and almond butter offer protein and healthy fats. The electrolyte drink ensures hydration and sodium replacement. This aligns with the recommendation to consume a high-carb meal 3-4 hours prior to exercise (ISSN2017, ACSM2016).
israel_alternatives: Shredded wheat with banana and honey
Peanut butter on whole wheat toast

meals.name: Pre-Workout Snack
meals.rationale: This snack provides a quick source of carbohydrates to top up glycogen stores before the second workout. The sports gel and electrolyte drink ensure adequate carbohydrate intake and sodium replacement. This aligns with the recommendation to consume a small carb top-up 30-60 minutes pre-workout (ISSN2017, ACSM2016).

meals.name: Post-Workout Lunch
meals.rationale: This meal provides a balanced mix of carbohydrates and protein to support muscle recovery and glycogen replenishment. The grilled chicken breast offers high-quality protein, while the quinoa and broccoli provide carbohydrates and additional protein. The olive oil adds healthy fats. The electrolyte drink ensures hydration and sodium replacement. This aligns with the recommendation to consume a mixed meal with 0.8 g/kg carbs and 0.2-0.3 g/kg protein within an hour post-exercise (ISSN2017, ACSM2016).
israel_alternatives: Grilled fish with quinoa and vegetables

meals.name: Midday Snack
meals.rationale: This snack provides a mix of carbohydrates, protein, and healthy fats to sustain energy levels and support recovery. The apple offers readily available carbohydrates, while the almonds provide protein and healthy fats. This aligns with the recommendation to consume balanced meals and snacks throughout the day (ISSN2017, ACSM2016).

meals.name: Pre-Dinner Snack

foods.item: 1 sports bar (40g carbs, 10g protein, 5g fat, 150mg sodium)

meals.rationale: This snack provides a quick source of carbohydrates and protein to sustain energy levels and support muscle recovery. The sports bar and electrolyte drink ensure adequate carbohydrate intake and sodium replacement. This aligns with the recommendation to consume balanced meals and snacks throughout the day (ISSN2017, ACSM2016).
israel_alternatives: Energy bar with a sports drink

meals.name: Dinner
meals.rationale: This meal provides a balanced mix of carbohydrates, protein, and healthy fats to support muscle recovery and glycogen replenishment. The grilled salmon offers high-quality protein and healthy fats, while the sweet potato and spinach provide carbohydrates and additional nutrients. The olive oil adds healthy fats. The electrolyte drink ensures hydration and sodium replacement. This aligns with the recommendation to consume a balanced meal with adequate protein and carbohydrates for recovery (ISSN2017, ACSM2016).
israel_alternatives: Grilled chicken with quinoa and vegetables

meals.name: Evening Snack
meals.rationale: This snack provides a mix of carbohydrates and protein to support muscle recovery and glycogen replenishment. The Greek yogurt offers high-quality protein, while the honey provides readily available carbohydrates. This aligns with the recommendation to consume balanced meals and snacks throughout the day (ISSN2017, ACSM2016).

key_recommendations: Consume a high-carb meal 3-4 hours before workouts to top off glycogen stores (ISSN2017, ACSM2016).
Include a small carb top-up 30-60 minutes before workouts to maintain blood glucose levels (ISSN2017, ACSM2016).
Consume a balanced meal with 0.8 g/kg carbs and 0.2-0.3 g/kg protein within an hour post-exercise to support muscle recovery and glycogen replenishment (ISSN2017, ACSM2016).
Ensure adequate hydration and sodium replacement throughout the day, especially around workouts (ISSN2017, ACSM2016).
Consume balanced meals and snacks throughout the day to sustain energy levels and support recovery (ISSN2017, ACSM2016).
